intro: Prionolepis silphioides, commonly known as the silphioid dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Prionolepis silphioides is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects.
